de.javasoft.swing.filter
Interface IColumnFilterFactory<M>

All Known Implementing Classes:
ColumnFilterFactories.BooleanColumnFilterFactory, ColumnFilterFactories.CollectionColumnFilterFactory, ColumnFilterFactories.ComparableColumnFilterFactory, ColumnFilterFactories.DateColumnFilterFactory, ColumnFilterFactories.PatternColumnFilterFactory, ColumnFilterFactories.SimpleColumnFilterFactory
public interface IColumnFilterFactory<M>

Factory to create an ColumnFilter.

A custom factory can be used to configure which ColumnFilter to create and use for a column class or a particular column. F.i. to install a boolean mapping to the localized true/false string representation, implement a factory and set on the JYTable or a particular column: 

 
 ColumnFilterFactory factory = new BooleanColumnFilterFactory() {
     public ColumnFilter createColumnFilter(int tableColumn) {
         BooleanColumnFilter filter = (BooleanColumnFilter) super.createColumnFilter(tableColumn);
         filter.setStringValue(de.javasoft.swing.jytable.renderer.StringValues.createTrueFalseLookup());
         return filter;
     }
     
 };
 table.setDefaultColumnFilterFactory(Boolean.class, factory);
 ((JYTableColumnExt) table.getColumnExt(myIndex)).setColumnFilterFactory(factory);

Method Summary
 ColumnFilter<M> createColumnFilter(int tableColumn)
          Creates and returns an ColumnFilter for the given TableColumn.
 

Method Detail

createColumnFilter

ColumnFilter<M> createColumnFilter(int tableColumn)
Creates and returns an ColumnFilter for the given TableColumn.

Parameters:
tableColumn - the columnIndex of the table column to filter
Returns:
a ColumnFilter for the given column, guaranteed to not be null.
